001
002package com.commercetools.docs.meta;
003
004/**
005 * {@include.toc}
006 * <h2 id=features>Features</h2>
007 *
008 * <h3 id=embracing-java-8>Embracing Java 8</h3>
009 *
010 * <p>The SDK API uses:</p>
011 *
012 * <ul>
013 *     <li>{@link java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage}</li>
014 *     <li>Java Date API: {@link java.time.ZonedDateTime}, {@link java.time.LocalDate} and {@link java.time.LocalTime}</li>
015 *     <li>{@link FunctionalInterface functional interfaces}</li>
016 * </ul>
017 * <h3 id=request-builders>Request builders</h3>
018 *
019 * <p>The SDK provides a request builder which allows to explore the API while writing the program.</p>
020 *
021 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#performRequest()}
022 *
023 * <p>The request method objects are immutable as shown in this example.</p>
024 *
025 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#immutableRequest()}
026 *
027 * <h3 id=defaults>Good defaults for equals() and hashCode()</h3>
028 *
029 * <p>The SDK's model implementation classes provide default implementations for the methods.</p>
030 *
031 * <h3 id=client-interfaces>Client interfaces</h3>
032 *
033 * <p>The HTTP client abstract itself is a functional interface and can be replaced with test doubles.</p>
034 *
035 * <h3 id=model-factories>Model factory methods</h3>
036 *
037 * <p>Each model has a factory method {@code ::of()} to create a new empty instance. The method {@code ::builder()}
038 * returns a new builder instance.</p>
039 *
040 * <h3 id=middlewares>Middlewares</h3>
041 *
042 * <p>The client supports middlewares to adjust request and responses while being executed.
043 * A {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.http.Middleware middleware} is a functional interface
044 * which has the request and the next middleware as an argument and returns a CompletableFuture with the response. The following
045 * example shows how to add an additional header.</p>
046 *
047 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#middleware()}
048 *
049 * <p>The authentication, logging and other functionality has been implemented in middlewares and is added by default to the {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.http.HandlerStack}
050 * in the {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.ClientBuilder}</p>
051 */
052public class Features {
053}
